variant.bodyText: The International Fund was set up to make ACL memberships and publications available to colleagues who have difficulty in using their national currencies for international transactions. Recently, we have broadened it to allow us to reach people whose current financial situation makes it impossible for them to join the Associ- ation. One recent member in this category, a student in India, provides an appropriate model to justify this form of participation. He states that when he is further along in his graduate studies, he will reimburse the Interna- tional Fund for its support. While there should be no requirement to do that, it is a way of ensuring that access to these sources of information are made widely avail- able. If anyone knows of others in similar situations in any part of the world, please provide the ACL office with names and addresses. And do not hesitate to make contributions directly to the International Fund to enable us to extend this program.
